transcripts.text: So, like I said earlier, Donald Trump finally, finally used the Defense Protection Act to require an anonymous company to produce swabs.  They couldn't do the testing because they didn't have the swabs.  You know where the big manufacturer of swabs was in the world?  Take a guess, Jamie.
Where the big manufacturer of swabs was?  China.

The other place that was devastated by coronavirus.  So we have this shortage of swabs.  He finally breaks down because apparently he can't find a buddy who's in the swab business.  Here he is asked by Alice Olsteen.  She's the Politico healthcare reporter.  Why Trump delayed so long when we've been talking about the shortage of swabs for a month?  I mean, I know we talked about it when I was up here in this fake studio.  I mean, I guess both studios are fake.  But so it's been almost a month.  You said swabs are easy, and this has been something that hospitals and states have been saying.  there are shortages for more than a month now.  Why wait to use the Defense Production Act until now?

Well, we already have millions coming in.  We have one company that we're forced to use it with, and probably by tomorrow we won't be.  You know, it's a tremendous hammer.  Probably by tomorrow it won't be, but we have millions of them coming in.

By comparison, and in all fairness, Governors could get them themselves.  They really could.  All of this, but we're going to do it.  We're going to work with the governors, and if they can't do it, we're going to do it.  If they do it, we can do it maybe cheaper, better.  We're getting very high quality.  With us, it's all quality, too.  Even if it takes a little bit longer, we want the highest quality in all of it, including the ventilators.  Yeah, we have millions of them coming in very soon, and many of them already have been ordered, and the governors don't know quite where they are, but they'll be finding them fairly soon.

You know, the idea that every single question after that wouldn't be a follow-up on that.  Excuse me, sir.  The question was, why did you wait a month?  Not that they're in the mail now, which is also a lie.  His big tell is when he looks back for one of his cronies to nod so that it makes it look like his lie is legit.  But the question was, why did you wait a month when we have all known that there are shortages?  And then the lie, oh, we're trying to get high quality swabs, the best quality swabs, because you know you want them to be able to be reused.  Like he would all use swabs.  It's absurd.  There's no high quality swap.  What the hell does that mean?  It's just the level of lying.  It's just stunning.

He's doing a really crappy, crappy commercial.  And they should be forming compacts.  Like every day they go in there and they should pick like three questions and that's it.  We're going to get them to answer these three questions.
No matter how many times he tries to bully various reporters.

I just, I know I talked about this earlier, but I want to just remind people.  there was a letter published in the New England Journal of Medicine.  And this is right at this.  You can see this right up in New York magazine.  where the federal government is literally confiscating this material from states so they can give it to private enterprise to resell it at another markup.
